instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00163: What is 820-00163? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.D7105: What is D7105? Diodes between PPDCIN_G3H charger voltage and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, when CHGR_DCIN Is low(less than charger voltage) and PPBUS_G3H is missing this is a critical point to troubleshoot.
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.CHGR_DCIN: What is CHGR_DCIN? CHGR_DCIN comes directly from charger into ISL6258 or ISL6259, the resistor before it can be blown when there are surges. Should be checked when PPBUS_G3H is missing.
definitions.R7105: What is R7105? resistor between charger and CHGR_DCIN pin of ISL6259, if CHGR_DCIN is low then this resistor is probably blown. When PPBUS_G3H is low or missing this is something to check if your model has CHGR_DCIN along R7005. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
This was liquid damage, after cleaning in ULSC the DDCIN was missing due short on <CAPACITOR>C7190</CAPACITOR> which blow <DIODE>D7105</DIODE> , replaced <CAPACITOR>C7190</CAPACITOR> and <DIODE>D7105</DIODE>, now getting 20v , still no power, checked all other 3v42 PPBUS all there, but not getting any voltage on <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>PPV5_S5</SIGNAL> .
no short to these lines or any damage chipset , i soldered wire from <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> (PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC_  and  got 3.3v now to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> but <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> still missing , when inject 5v to it still no fan spin or heat on cpu ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
"i soldered wire from <CAPACITOR>C5125</CAPACITOR> (PP3V3_S5_AVREF_SMC_ and got 3.3v now to <SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>"
Stop to do things like that.
AVREF of SMC is a low power rail...

Do you have magsafe light?

Dead <DIODE>D7105</DIODE> usually meant burnt <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> and <RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> too (open).
Any voltage at <SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL>?
Check for short if not.

Post voltage to F7140/41.
If nothing, post resistance to ground.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
I got green light on the magsafe , 
<RESISTOR>R7105</RESISTOR> is 20v 
<SIGNAL>CHGR_DCIN</SIGNAL> 20V 
F7140, F7141 IS 12.25V 
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP> LOOKS CLEAN

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message:
Change SMC.
Be sure 3V42 power rail has correct voltage first...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00163</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> has no power , missing <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL>
threads.message: If <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL> is 3.3, then yes change SMC itâ€™s dead. As 2informaticos asked, voltage on PP3v42?
